SW200.name: Introduction to Social Work
SW200.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SW200.description: Social work practice, ethics, and values, in the context of social welfare policy in the United States.

SW290.name: Selected Topics in Social Work
SW290.description: Topics in social welfare, social policy, service delivery, research, theory, and practice. Basic social worker values and concepts.

SW310.name: Human Behavior and Social Environment
SW310.description: Integration of general systems, ecological, and developmental theories within the context of lifespan development. Integration of biological, psychological, structural, environmental, and socio-cultural perspectives.
SW310.prerequisite: (SOC 100 and PSY 101 and SW 200) and (HNF 150 or PSY 209 or PSL 250 or MMG 141) and (PSY 200 or PSY 235 or PSY 236 or PSY 244 or PSY 270 or PSY 280 or PSY 371)
SW310.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW320.name: Social Work and Social Policy I
SW320.description: History of social work and public policy in welfare, health, and civil rights. History of social welfare and interaction with the social work profession. Role of the legislative policy-making process. Roles of social work professionals in policy analysis, implementation, evaluation, and advocacy. Diversity, social justice, and international policy issues.
SW320.prerequisite: (SW 200) and (EC 201 or EC 202) and (PLS 100 or PLS 140)
SW320.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the School of Social Work.

SW340.name: Foundations of Social Work Practice
SW340.description: Ethical and philosophical basis for generalist social work practice. Interviewing skills, assessment, and problem solving within an ecological-systems and developmental framework.
SW340.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the School of Social Work.

SW420.name: Social Work and Social Policy II
SW420.description: Overview of social welfare policy analysis. Interaction between social policy and social work services. Current policy changes in welfare, health, poverty, disability, immigration, civil rights and their impact on society. Emphasis on diversity, social justice, and international policy issues.
SW420.prerequisite: SW 340 and (SW 440 or concurrently) and (SW 494A or concurrently)
SW420.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the School of Social Work.

SW430.name: Research Methods in Social Work I
SW430.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
SW430.description: Research processes employing quantitative methods in the measurement of outcomes of social work intervention.
SW430.prerequisite: (MTH 114 or MTH 116 or MTH 124 or MTH 132 or MTH 152H or STT 200 or STT 201 or approval of school) or (MTH 101 and MTH 102) or (MTH 101 and MTH 103) or (MTH 102 and MTH 103)
SW430.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the School of Social Work.

SW431.name: Research Methods in Social Work II
SW431.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SW431.description: Concepts and methodology for scientific evaluation of social work practice. Theory construction, research design, sampling, and data collection.
SW431.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the School of Social Work.

SW440.name: Social Work Practice with Individuals, Families, and Groups(W)
SW440.description: Social work intervention with individuals, families, and small groups.
SW440.prerequisite: (SW 340) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
SW440.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the School of Social Work.

SW441.name: Social Work Practice with Task Groups, Organizations and Communities
SW441.description: Planning and social intervention with task groups, organizations and communities.
SW441.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the School of Social Work.

SW470.name: Foreign Area Studies in Social Work
SW470.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SW470.description: Social work issues in settings outside the continental U.S.A.
SW470.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the School of Social Work.

SW471.name: Child Welfare
SW471.description: Social work practice and policy approaches to intervention. Needs and problems of children from the prenatal period through infancy, childhood, and adolescence.
SW471.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Social Work major and open to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW472.name: Social Work in Health Care
SW472.description: Psychosocial impact of illness and trauma. Social work practice in health care settings. Role of culture, values, and life style.
SW472.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Social Work major and open to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW474.name: Substance Abuse and the Human Services
SW474.description: Theories, assessment, intervention, and service delivery models.
SW474.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the School of Social Work or in the Master of Social Work in Clinical Social Work or in the Master of Social Work in Organizational and Community Practice or approval of school.

SW475.name: School Violence: Causes and Interventions
SW475.description: Examination of underlying causes of school violence and review of current school-based violence intervention and prevention programs.
SW475.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Social Work major and open to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW490.name: Independent Study in Social Work
SW490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SW490.description: Individual reading and research supervised by a Social Work faculty member.
SW490.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors. Approval of school.

SW490H.name: Honors Independent Study
SW490H.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SW490H.description: Study of a problem, phase or field of social work.
SW490H.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Honors College. Approval of school.

SW491.name: Special Topics in Social Work
SW491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SW491.description: Selected topics in social work. Topics include community dynamics or practice issues.
SW491.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Social Work Major and open to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW492.name: Seminar in Social Work
SW492.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SW492.description: Selected professional issues, trends, programs or methods in social work including comparative analysis of national social welfare and social work systems.
SW492.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Social Work major and open to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW493A.name: Social Work Field Education: Integrative Field Seminar I
SW493A.description: Classroom-based integration and application of competencies and concepts in social work practice.
SW493A.restrictions: Open to seniors in the School of Social Work.

SW493B.name: Social Work Field Education: Integrative Field Seminar II
SW493B.description: Continuation of classroom-based integration and application of competencies and concepts in social work practice.
SW493B.prerequisite: SW 493A and SW 494A and (SW 441 or concurrently)
SW493B.restrictions: Open to seniors in the School of Social Work.

SW494A.name: Social Work Field Education: Undergraduate Generalist Practice I
SW494A.description: Professionally supervised generalist social work practice in approved community agencies. Integration and application of concepts in social work practice.
SW494A.restrictions: Open to seniors in the School of Social Work.

SW494B.name: Social Work Field Education: Undergraduate Generalist Practice II
SW494B.description: Continuation of professionally supervised generalist social work practice in approved community agencies and campus-based seminar. Integration and application of concepts in social work practice. Focus on writing skills for professional practice and career options.
SW494B.restrictions: Open to seniors in the School of Social Work.

SW810.name: Theories of Groups, Organizations, and Communities in Social Work
SW810.description: Ecological and social systems perspectives. Theories of groups, formal organizations, and communities in a systems framework. Ethical and historical foundations of social work. Knowledge of the social, structural, and contextual factors that impact human functioning in a multi-system context.
SW810.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work.

SW811.name: Social Work Perspectives in Human Development
SW811.description: Developmental theories applied to individuals and families within an ecological and systems perspective. Biopsychosocial factors and interactions in human development for social work assessment and intervention.
SW811.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work.

SW812B.name: Integration of Theory, Policy, and Evaluation in Social Work
SW812B.description: Ecological concepts of communities, groups, families, and individuals. Policy development and evaluation of social work practice.
SW812B.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in School of Social Work.

SW820.name: Social Welfare Policy and Services
SW820.description: Social policy analysis in historical, economic, political, and ideological context. History of social welfare profession and influences of social movements on social policy. Introduction to major U.S. social welfare programs.
SW820.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW822.name: Topics in Policy Practice and Advocacy
SW822.description: Exploration of specific target populations or areas of need and related public policies. Information and skills for policy practice and advocacy.
SW822.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work.

SW829.name: Social Work Research Methods I
SW829.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SW829.description: Knowledge and skills in critical thinking and statistical methods. Concepts of data, distributions, samples and populations, measurement, descriptive statistics, inferential statistics and related topics using either SPSS or Excel. Ethics, diversity, social justice issues.
SW829.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work.

SW830.name: Social Work Research Methods II
SW830.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SW830.description: Foundation of research skills and methodologies. Evidence-based practice. Literature reviews. Advanced single system designs. Experimental and quasi-experimental research designs. Measurement and sampling.
SW830.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work.

SW832.name: Evaluating Social Work Programs and Practice
SW832.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SW832.description: Applied social work methods in a program evaluation framework. Evaluation in the context of research. Evaluation of program process and outcomes objectives. Scales of measurement. Survey, field and qualitative research methods. Sampling strategies. Computer technologies in social work evaluation. Data analysis and dissemination of findings.
SW832.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work.

SW833.name: Topics in Advanced Social Work Research
SW833.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SW833.description: Advanced social work research designs and evaluation techniques. Research collaborations and the role of stakeholders. Application of research methods and statistics to contemporary problems and settings in social work.
SW833.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work.

SW840.name: Generalist Social Work Practice Methods I
SW840.description: Ethical and philosophical basis for professional practice and accountability in engagement and assessment, across all client systems.
SW840.restrictions: Open to master's students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW841.name: Generalist Social Work Practice: Methods II
SW841.description: Implementation of models of social work practice for work with individuals, dyads, families, groups, and communities. Implementation of social work practice-research orientation across the life cycle.
SW841.restrictions: Open to master's students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW842B.name: Advanced Generalist Social Work Practice Methods
SW842B.description: Selection, implementation, and evaluation of models of social work intervention.
SW842B.restrictions: Open to master's students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW843.name: Clinical Assessment and Diagnosis
SW843.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SW843.description: Biopsychosocial disturbances and clinical assessment. Social work perspectives of the person-in-environment as related to maladaptive behavior and psychosocial disorders. Cultural perspectives, including gender, age, and minority status in relation to psychological and behavior disorders.
SW843.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work.

SW844.name: Essential Theories in Organizations and Communities Social Work Practice
SW844.description: Theoretical frameworks associated with the study of leadership, organizations and communities in social work practice.
SW844.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW845.name: Administrative Skills in Social Work
SW845.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SW845.description: Knowledge and skills for social work practice in an organizational context.
SW845.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Social Work in Clinical Social Work - Two Year Program or in the Master of Social Work in Clinical Social Work - One Year Program or approval of school.

SW850.name: Clinical Social Work Practice I
SW850.description: Theoretical base of advanced clinical social work practice with individuals and groups. Evidence-based and culturally sensitive intervention strategies and techniques. Professional development and use of self to enhance clinical effectiveness.
SW850.restrictions: Open to master's students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW851.name: Clinical Social Work Practice II
SW851.description: Theoretical base for clinical social work practice with couples and families. Culturally sensitive intervention strategies and techniques. Student self-reflection on family of origin to enhance clinical effectiveness.
SW851.restrictions: Open to master's students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW865.name: Social Work Leadership in Organizations
SW865.description: Knowledge and skills to promote change in programs and organizations using adaptive leadership.
SW865.restrictions: Open to master's students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW866.name: Social Work Leadership in Communities
SW866.description: Advanced community practice to promote social justice and assess community assets and needs.
SW866.restrictions: Open to master's students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW871.name: Advanced Clinical Social Work with Families
SW871.description: Family intervention skills. Case problem solving in empirically-based practice.
SW871.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the School of Social Work.

SW873.name: Social Work in Educational Settings
SW873.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
SW873.description: Roles and functions of social workers within a complex ecological system of home, school, and community. Impact of societal laws and values on the school and on the students' schooling experience. Implications for social work practice involving prevention and intervention with a variety of client systems.
SW873.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of School.

SW874.name: Assessment and Testing in School Social Work
SW874.semester: Spring of even years, Summer of every year
SW874.description: School social worker's assessment of student needs within the ecology of school, home and community environments. Integration of various measurement methods and data generated by educational, psychological, and medical testing within the broad problem-solving processes of schools. Implications for school social work assessment practices.
SW874.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of School.

SW875.name: School Social Work Intervention: Children with Special Needs
SW875.semester: Spring of odd years, Summer of every year
SW875.description: Identifying and working with children who present special needs in school settings. Children's learning, social, emotional and behavioral difficulties. Interventions defined according to developmental and ecological or multi-systems frameworks. Special needs are defined and treated within the complex interactions and relationships of home, school, and community contexts.
SW875.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of School.

SW876.name: Substance Use, Mental Health and Co-Occurring Disorders: Treatment and Intervention Strategies
SW876.description: Theories, assessment, interventions and policy related to work with dual-diagnosis people/co-occurring disorder. Social and human service delivery models of treatment addressed within socio-political, clinical, and historical context.
SW876.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW877A.name: Seminar in Social Work with Older Adults: Mental Health
SW877A.description: Issues and research relevant to social work practice with older adults. Dementias, psychopharmacology, and mental health.
SW877A.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW877B.name: Seminar in Social Work with Older Adults: Illness and Wellness
SW877B.description: Issues and research relevant to social work practice with older adults. Managing chronic illness, wellness, substance abuse.
SW877B.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW877C.name: Seminar in Social Work with Older Adults: Protective Services
SW877C.description: Issues and research relevant to social work practice with older adults. Adult protective services
SW877C.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW877D.name: Seminar in Social Work with Older Adults: Legal Issues and Eldercare
SW877D.description: Issues and research relevant to social work practice with older adults. Grief and loss. Legal issues and eldercare. Gay and lesbian issues.
SW877D.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW878.name: Substance Use and Addictions Treatment
SW878.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
SW878.description: Knowledge and skills in evidence-based treatment approaches for addiction concerns. Attention to diagnosis, assessment, and prevention processes that support cross-cultural and ethical considerations within multidisciplinary treatment contexts. Managing long-term recovery as a part of whole health.
SW878.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW879.name: Social Work and Law: Interdisciplinary Practice in Child Welfare
SW879.description: Social service and legal systems related to child welfare. Family law issues. Social work and legal practices and procedures in child welfare.
SW879.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the MSU College of Law or in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW890.name: Independent Study
SW890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SW890.description: Independent reading and research supervised by a faculty member.

SW891.name: Special Topics in Graduate Social Work
SW891.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SW891.description: Topics in social welfare, social policy, service delivery, research, theory, and practice.
SW891.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW892.name: Graduate Seminars in Social Work
SW892.description: Selected professional issues, trends, programs, research, or methods in social work.
SW892.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in School of Social Work.

SW893B.name: Social Work Field Education: Graduate Advanced Generalist Practice
SW893B.description: Professionally supervised foundations of social work practice in approved community agencies. Integration and application of concepts in social work practice.
SW893B.restrictions: Open to master's students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW894A.name: Social Work Field Education: Graduate Generalist Practice I
SW894A.description: Professionally supervised foundations of social work practice in approved community agencies. Integration and application of concepts in social work practice.
SW894A.restrictions: Open to master's students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW894B.name: Social Work Field Education: Graduate Generalist Practice II
SW894B.description: Continuation of professionally supervised foundations of social work practice in approved community agencies. Integration and application of concepts in social work practice.
SW894B.restrictions: Open to master's students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW894D.name: Social Work Field Education: Clinical Practice I
SW894D.description: Professionally supervised clinical social work practice with individuals, dyads, families, and small groups in approved community agencies. Integration and application of concepts in social work practice.
SW894D.restrictions: Open to master's students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW894E.name: Social Work Field Education: Clinical Practice II
SW894E.description: Continuation of professionally supervised clinical social work practice with individuals, dyads, families and small groups in approved community agencies. Integration and application of concepts in social work practice.
SW894E.restrictions: Open to master's students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW894G.name: Social Work Field Education: Macro Practice I
SW894G.description: Professionally supervised organization and community social work practice in approved community agencies. Integration and application of concepts in social work practice.
SW894G.restrictions: Open to master's students in the School of Social Work or approval of school.

SW894I.name: Social Work Field Education: Macro Practice II
SW894I.description: Continuation of professionally supervised organization and community social work practice in approved community agencies. Integration and application of concepts in social work practice.
SW894I.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Social Work.

SW900.name: Doctoral Proseminar in Social Work
SW900.description: Major issues in social work practice, theory, and research. Social work and the social science disciplines.
SW900.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students in the School of Social Work.

SW901.name: Knowledge Construction in Social Work
SW901.description: Historical evolution and contemporary status of social work knowledge. Epistemological and ethical issues in the construction of social work theory and knowledge.
SW901.restrictions: Open only to students in the Social Work major.

SW902.name: Research in Social Welfare and Social Work History
SW902.description: Historical research in social welfare and social work. Examine major writings in the history of American social welfare and social work.
SW902.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students in the School of Social Work.

SW905.name: Historical and Current Analysis of Social Work and Social Problems
SW905.description: Assessing social welfare policies, the historical underpinnings of social policies, problems and the use of analytic frameworks to examine the current situation.
SW905.prerequisite: SW 900 or concurrently or approval of school
SW905.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the School of Social Work.

SW910.name: Social Problems and Social Policy
SW910.description: Impact of public policies on social problems, social welfare, social programs, and social work practice. Application of analytical frameworks to selected areas of social welfare.
SW910.restrictions: Open to students in the Social Work major.

SW911.name: Research Sequence Practicum I
SW911.description: Exploration of research process, including formulation of research question, literature review, survey design and sampling.
SW911.prerequisite: (SW 900 or concurrently) and (SW 920 or concurrently) or approval of school
SW911.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the School of Social Work.

SW912.name: Research Sequence Practicum II
SW912.description: Continuation of the exploration of the research process; beginning with data collection, data cleaning, coding, analyses and presentation of data.
SW912.prerequisite: SW 911 or concurrently or approval of school
SW912.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the School of Social Work.

SW920.name: Evaluation of Social Work Services and Practice
SW920.description: Evaluation of social service organizations, service delivery, and practice outcomes. Evaluation models, design issues, and professional roles in planning and implementing evaluation studies of social work practice.
SW920.restrictions: Open to students in the Social Work major.

SW930.name: Social Work Research Using Quantitative and Qualitative Methods
SW930.description: Advanced research methods using quantitative and qualitative methodologies used in evaluation of social work practice, policies and programs.
SW930.prerequisite: SW 900 or concurrently or approval of school
SW930.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the School of Social Work.

SW990.name: Independent Study in Social Work
SW990.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SW990.description: Individual study of theoretical or applied problem in social work.
SW990.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Social Work major. Approval of school.

SW999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
SW999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SW999.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the School of Social Work.
